Perfect! I've made the necessary changes to both files:

## Changes Made:

1. **Modified `app/globals.css`**:
   - Changed the `.aurora-container` positioning from `fixed` to `absolute`
   - Changed `width: 100vw` to `width: 100%` so it respects its parent container
   - Changed `height: 40vh` to `height: 100%` so it fills the hero section

2. **Modified `app/page.tsx`**:
   - Moved the `<Aurora>` component from outside the main element to inside the hero section
   - The hero section already has `relative` positioning and `overflow-hidden`, which will contain the Aurora background

## Result:

Now the Aurora background will:
- Only appear in the hero section at the top of the page
- Not be absolutely positioned on top of everything
- Stay contained within the hero section boundaries
- Still maintain its beautiful animated effect but only in the designated area

The background will no longer cover the entire viewport and will be properly contained within the hero section as requested.
